intro: Silphiodaucus prutenicus subsp. dufourianus, commonly known as the Dufour's false hellebore, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a protected species in several regions.
